title: Biden Promised More Aid to Ukraine. Congress May Not Fund It
description: Despite Biden’s promises to Ukraine on the world stage, it’s not clear he’ll have enough support at home to keep the cash flowing.

title: There’s Something Sad About Barbenheimer
description: Both movies succeeding at the box office won’t be nearly enough to solve Hollywood’s myriad problems.

title: Iowa Abortion Providers Scramble to See Patients Before 6-Week Ban Takes Effect
description: “It’s an all-hands-on-deck type of situation right now."

title: This June Was the Hottest on Record And July Is Getting Hotter
description: “We are just getting a small taste for the types of impacts that we expect to worsen under climate change.”

title: Sometimes Writers Have to Take Sides
description: During the Spanish Civil War, leading writers were asked to take sides in the fight against Fascism.

title: The History Behind Kamala Harris Matching the 191-Year-Old Record for Tiebreaking Votes
description: Kamala Harris just matched John C. Calhoun for casting the most tiebreaking votes as Vice President.

title: Every Single Barbie Partnership That We Could Find
description: Mattel and Warner Bros. have collaborated with a number of brands ranging from Burger King to Crocs.

title: Issa Rae’s Rebooted Project Greenlight Is a Fascinating Snapshot of an Industry in Flux
description: Max revives the classic first-time-filmmaking reality show—and reveals the austerity and noise of Hollywood in 2023.

title: Why NATO’s Growing Interest in Asia Is a Mistake
description: A newfound focus on China's growing power in the Asia-Pacific could distract NATO from the war in Ukraine.

title: Miguel Cardona: Supreme Court Was ‘Wrong’ and ‘Backwards’ on Student Loans and Affirmative Action
description: The Education Secretary spoke to TIME about recent Supreme Court decisions, pandemic learning loss, and teacher shortages.

title: There’s Now a Rapid, Accurate COVID-19 Air Detector
description: Knowing where the virus is lurking in real time could reduce the spread of disease.

title: The True Story Behind the Hulu Documentary The Jewel Thief
description: The Jewel Thief details the life of Gerald Blanchard, who pulled off several world-spanning heists

title: Why Rick Perry’s Disastrous 2012 Run Should Haunt Ron DeSantis
description: More than a decade later, DeSantis should study why Perry's presidential campaign failed.

title: Extreme Heat Is Hitting Companies Where It Hurts
description: The office air conditioning can feel like a refuge from the extremes outside, but it may be time for businesses to start feeling the heat.

title: Virginia Is Part of Successful Climate Alliance. Now Republicans Want to Abandon It
description: The Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative has cut emissions in 12 states by 50%, and raised $6 billion. Yet some want to ditch it.

title: Meet the 14 Members of the U.S. Women’s Soccer Team Going to the World Cup for the First Time
description: What to know about Trinity Rodman, Alyssa Thompson, and other tournament rookies

title: No Leads from Cocaine Found at the White House, Secret Service Says
description: The didn't find any fingerprints or DNA on the baggie, despite a sophisticated FBI crime lab analysis.

title: OpenAI’s ChatGPT Bot Probed by FTC Over Consumer Harms
description: The regulator has sent a request for information to startup OpenAI as part of a probe into its ChatGPT conversational AI bot

title: In Defense of Parasocial Relationships
description: Decades of research suggest that they’re good for the majority of people who engage in them—and for the celebrities on the other side.

title: Some Oceans Are Becoming Greener Thanks to Climate Change
description: More than half of the world’s ocean has changed colors in the past 20 years, a phenomenon likely driven by rising global temperatures.

title: The Northern Lights Won’t Be As Visible in the U.S. This Week as Previously Forecasted
description: An early forecast from the NOAA, suggested that the northern lights could be visible much farther south than usual.

title: Michelle Buteau’s Survival of the Thickest Can’t Decide What It’s Trying to Be
description: Michelle Buteau is a very funny comedian, but her new Netflix comedy can't figure out what kind of show it's trying to be.

title: Thailand’s Election Winner Fails First Parliament Vote to Become Prime Minister—What to Know and What Comes Next
description: Pita Limjaroenrat’s bid to become the next Prime Minister was just rejected by the country’s junta-appointed senate in the Thai parliament’s first round of voting for its next leader.

title: The First Over-the-Counter Birth Control Pill Gets Official Approval
description: The FDA announced that Perrigo’s once-a-day contraceptive Opill can now be purchased over-the-counter, without a prescription.

title: Steven Soderbergh’s Kidnapping Thriller Full Circle Weaves a Tangled But Tantalizing Web
description: As conceived by creator Ed Solomon, the trajectory of human life isn’t a straightforward circle of cause and effect; it’s a tangled web of emotion, self-interest, faith, luck, character flaws, and above all history.

title: The Problem with Ron DeSantis’ Claims About Crime in Florida
description: When DeSantis compares “crime-ridden” cities to the “safe” state of Florida, it's important to be honest about the data.

title: Playwright James Ijames on Writing Acts of Life
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning playwright on his experience growing up in the South and how his work explores 21st century masculinity.

title: Here’s Why Bali Plans to Start Charging a Tourist Tax
description: International tourists will be charged about $10 per person starting from next year, with the money to be used to preserve the province’s culture and environment.

title: Taiwan Proposes Tougher Penalties for Sexual Harassers Amid #MeToo Wave
description: President Tsai Ing-wen’s government moved to strengthen Taiwan’s equality laws after a series of sexual harassment scandals rocked the island’s political elite ahead of a critical election.

title: TikTok Influencer’s Arrest for Wealth Joke Video Exposes Limits on Freedoms in Dubai
description: Dubai is more socially lenient than much of the Middle East, but vaguely worded laws forbid any speech, including journalism and satire, that is deemed critical of authorities or insulting to the United Arab Emirates.

title: The Indian State of Manipur Is on the Verge of Civil War. Modi Hasn’t Said a Word About It
description: The northeastern Indian state is on the brink of civil war, as Prime Minister Modi, and much of the world, stay silent.

title: Two New Pandas Were Born in South Korea. Here’s Why They’ll Eventually End Up in China
description: Almost all pandas, even ones born abroad, are considered the property of China—as part of a loan program it has with selected zoos around the world.

title: Seoul Ships Arms to Poland as Ukraine Enlists Support From Asia
description: South Korean government policy prohibits lethal aid to countries at war and Ukraine’s envoy to Seoul says it’s time for a change, adding there’s a lot in its arsenal that could help Kyiv.
